Description: Body sherd of South Ionian Wild Goat style pottery lekanis (?) with horizontal strap handle; inside reserved; meander band on handle and handle zone; traces of decoration in frieze above; below animal frieze, one antler preserved amid thick filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 6, N 18)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 50-1, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.604)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2482 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
